text:
An elephant was shot at and its tail chopped off by unidentified persons in Assam’s Lakhimpur district, a forest official said here on Sunday. The elephant received eight bullet injuries and was struggling for life at Kashjuli under the Harmuti forest range near the Ranga Reserve Forest bordering Arunachal Pradesh.

Divisional Forest Officer Krishna Patgiri alleged that the elephant was shot by suspected poachers from the Arunachal side of the reserve forest.

A hunt is on to nab the poachers, officials said. — PTI
title: Elephant shot at, tail chopped off
